definitions.definition: To add something to another thing, especially territory ; to incorporate .
examples: The ancient city of Petra was annexed by Rome.

definitions.definition: To attach or connect, as a consequence, condition, etc.
examples: to annex a penalty to a prohibition, or punishment to guilt

main_definition: To add something to another thing, especially territory ; to incorporate .
secondary_definitions: To attach or connect, as a consequence, condition, etc.
( intransitive ) To join; to be united.
